intro: Odina stuhlmannii var. brevifoliolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved odina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of delicate, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Botanically, it belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with similar morphological traits.
